page.title: 04Gatcombe Village
page.content: {Edward Heal writes}- The name is of Saxon origin and probably means 'The Valley of Goats'. Some of the 24 homes lie along the stream surrounded by farm land in this east-west valley. St Olave's Church was built as a memorial chapel for the manor mentioned in the original Domesday as belonging to the Estur family. The present elegant Gat- combe House dates from 1750 (photo). The I.W.Foxhound have their kennels in the village. Many of the cottages were built for farmworkers mostly as part of the Seely Estate which was sold up in l926. In about l912 an agreement was made between the Estate and Sandown and Shanklin Council that in return for having a reservoir at Tolt that all the houses should have{free {water.}56 people live in the valley at Gatcombe.
